body: There are two common definitions of logits, one corresponding to log-likelihood and one corresponding to log-odds. The `logits` arg to `Categorical` is the former. The `logits` arg to `Bernoulli` is the latter and is equal to `log(p / (1-p))`. If we were to implement `Bernoulli` via `Categorical`, the logits would be a pair of numbers `[log(p), log(1-p)]` but `Bernoulli` can simply use the log-ratio of the two.
